subject: Communication
title: Aristotle's Three Modes of Persuasion
description: A quick, practical guide to Aristotle's Three Modes of Persuasion.

hook.text: Aristotle said every persuasive speech works through three channels ‚Äî and most speakers only use one.

buildup.text: Ethos is credibility: why should they trust you? Pathos is emotion: why should they care?

discovery.text: Logos is logic: does your argument actually hold up? The best speeches blend all three seamlessly.

twist.text: Pure logos bores people. Pure pathos manipulates them. Pure ethos sounds like name-dropping.

climax.text: Martin Luther King's 'I Have a Dream' used all three: moral authority, emotion, and evidence.

punchline.text: Persuasion isn't one trick. It's a triangle.

quiz.question: Which of Aristotle's modes of persuasion relates to emotion?
